This is the speaking in public indicator. The variable indicates that the individual is comfortable speaking in public in at least one context.

This variable is a recode of G201_C. It is coded as 1 if the individual participated in the ACTIVITY within the past 12 months. It is coded 0 otherwise. Those who do not know, refuse, or have missing data are treated as missing on this recoded measure. ACTIVITY Livestock raising
This variable is a recode of G301A_C. It indicates that the household owns the ITEM . ITEM Small livestock (Country-specific examples)

This variable is a recode of G404_G. The variable indicates that the respondent knows of this type of group in her community. Women who respond No or indicate that they do not know are coded as a 0 on this measure. GROUP
This variable is a recode of G303_D. It indicates that the individual can decide to sell the ITEM either individually or jointly with other individuals. ITEM Chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigeons

This variable is a recode of G501_G, G502_G. The variable represents whether the woman makes decisions or feels that she could make decisions regarding ACTIVITY . It is coded as 1 if the woman is the sole person who makes decisions (G5.01) or if the woman feels that she could make a decision (G5.02) regarding ACTIVITY . The woman is counted as feeling she could make a decision if she indicated to a small extent (2), medium extent (3), or to a high extent (4). ACTIVITY Minor household expenditures (such as food for daily consumption or other household needs)

This variable is the indicator for asset ownership. An individual is adequate if she owns at least two small assets (chicken, farming equipment non-mechanized, and small consumer durables) or one large asset. This measure is based on the selfjointown_sum measure. This is the same as saying: empowered if owns AT LEAST ONE asset and that asset is not a small asset. Inadequate if lives in a household that owns no assets.

This variable is a recode of G404_D. The variable indicates that the respondent knows of this type of group in their community. Women who respond No or indicate that they do not know are coded as a 0 on this measure. GROUP

This variable is a recode of G202_F. The variable indicates that an individual has decisionmaking ability over ACTIVITY . It is coded as 1 if the individual has input into some decisions (G202 2) or input into most or all decisions (G202 3). Those who have no input or input into very few decisions (1) are coded as a zero. Those who do not participate in an activity (G2.01 2), report that no decision was made (G202 93), or refuse (G202 99) are coded as missing. ACTIVITY Fishing or fishpond culture

This variable is a recode of G305_C. It indicates that the individual can decide to rent the ITEM either individually or jointly with other individuals. ITEM Small livestock (Country-specific examples)

This variable is a recode of G203_C. The variable indicates that an individual has decisionmaking ability over income generated from ACTIVITY . It is coded as 1 if the individual if the individual has input into some decisions (2) or input into most or all decisions (3). Those who have no input or input into very few decisions (1) are coded as a zero. Those who do not participate in an activity (G2.01 2), report that no decision was made (G203 93), or refuse (G203 99) are coded as missing. ACTIVITY Livestock raising

This variable is a recode of G307_E. The variable indicates that someone in the household has taken loans or borrowed cash and or in-kind resources from SOURCE . SOURCE Group based micro-finance or lending including VSLAs SACCOs merry-go-rounds

This variable is a recode of G303_B. It indicates that the individual can decide to sell the ITEM either individually or jointly with other individuals. ITEM Large livestock (Country-specific examples)
Administrative variable for identifying the sampling strata.

This variable is the indicator for the workload threshold. It identifies women whose combined total of primary and secondary work time is less than or equal to 10.5 hours. Women who work more than 10.5 hours in the prior day are considered inadequate.

This variable is a recode of G202_C. The variable indicates that an individual has decisionmaking ability over ACTIVITY . Those who have no input or input into very few decisions (1) are coded as a zero. resource.name: REVIVE Climate Change Adaptation in Oromia, Ethiopia: Baseline Dataset
resource.description:
The baseline dataset for this study contains 1439 observations over 156 variables. The data describe animal numbers with some socio-demographic information and some opinions.

These data come from the Restoring Vibrant Villages and Environments (REVIVE) project in 9 woredas of Oromia region of Ethiopia. Project REVIVE is a three­year project to increase vulnerable communities’ long­term resilience to climate change and climate­-related shocks.

resource.name: Agricultural Land Dynamics and Land Policy in Rural Tanzania 2016: Livestock Costs Dataset
resource.description:
This dataset contains information about costs associated with livestock inputs. The table can be combined with other datasets in this data asset using the 'hhid' column.

The purpose of collecting these data was to examine farm expansion and labor markets in rural Tanzania. Data were collected in 8 rural districts of Tanzania: Mvomero, Kilombero, Njombe, Kiteto, Magu, Moshi Rural, Mkuranga and Liwale.

The data were collected through the Feed the Future Innovation Lab for Food Security Policy (FSP).

domain_metadata.value: Margaret Beaver. 2019. Agricultural Land Dynamics and Land Policy in Rural Tanzania 2016: Livestock Costs Dataset. Dataset. USAID Development Data Library. https://data.usaid.gov/d/yv95-8ztk.
See the word document "2016_ALDSDataFileNotes.doc" for details on specific variables that may have data issues. Some plot areas were not allocated by crop but given as total area (see notes)
